title: go.talks: sandbox runs out of memory for an example in an existing talk
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Open http://talks.golang.org/2012/concurrency.slide#39
2. Click on Run
3. See error message

fatal error: out of memory (stackcacherefill)

goroutine 1 [running]:
[fp=0x7fb0f882ce70] runtime.malg(0xc000001000)
	go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1466 +0xf1
[fp=0x7fb0f882ceb0] runtime.newproc1(0x12d8160, 0x7fb0f882cf00, 0x10, 0x120cd3d)
	go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1524 +0x1ea
[fp=0x7fb0f882cef0] runtime.newproc()
	go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1495 +0x53
[fp=0x7fb0f882cf90] main.main()
	/tmpfs/gosandbox-a946dd73_5e476bbc_310cea84_9c323158_b53c2c45/prog.go:19 +0xad
[fp=0x7fb0f882cfb8] runtime.main()
	go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:184 +0x5f
[fp=0x7fb0f882cfc0] runtime.goexit()
	go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1227

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

It should print just an integer result of running the program.
